intro: Dimorphostachys oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxaca thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in the Sierra Madre mountains. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
